issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description: Get message: "/usr/bin/python: can't open file '/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/1.8.1/project.py': [Errno 2] No such file or directory" when trying to create a new Mobile project. I can create a Desktop project without any hiccups.
fields.summary: Missing project.py when creating new Mobile project

comments.body:
Paul,
is this still happening to you? Did you just install? Which Xcode are you using? 

Best,

Mauro
Any resolution to this? I am having the same exact issue on a fresh install of everything. xcode 4.2 btw.
I'm having the same problem.  Getting this version of appcelerator working with any version of Xcode (4.3,4.21,4.2) has been a big hassle.

Hello,
Please share the Ti Studio -> Help -> Ti Studio -> Run diagnostics output.

Best,

Mauro

My diagnostic output is below.  Thank you for your help.


Host OS: Mac OS X
OS Arch: x86
JRE Version: 1.6.0_26
JRE Vendor: Apple Inc.
JRE Home: /System/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/1.6.0.jdk/Contents/Home

Version: 1.0.8.201201262211
VM Arguments: -Xms40m
-Xmx1024m
-Declipse.p2.unsignedPolicy=allow
-Declipse.log.size.max=10000
-Declipse.log.backup.max=5
-Xdock:icon=../Resources/titanium.icns
-XstartOnFirstThread
-Dorg.eclipse.swt.internal.carbon.smallFonts
-XX:MaxPermSize=256m
-Djava.class.path=/Applications/Titanium Studio/TitaniumStudio.app/Contents/MacOS//../../../plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.1.1.R36x_v20101122_1400.jar

Language: en_US

Titanium Desktop SDK Version: 1.1.0
Titanium Desktop SDK Location: /Library/Application Support/Titanium/sdk/osx/1.1.0

hello guys,

can you please share the build.log as well?

BEst,

Mauro
I tried leaving this beforeâ€¦. My problems disappeared when I installed the Android SDK. I'm not doing Android dev, so hadn't bothered. Now no problem...

Customer stoped having this issue when installed the android sdk. 

Best,

Mauro

Hello, I updated the Android SDK and updated the Titanium SDK. I even installed some of the non-essential Android SDK packages, but nothing has resolved my issue. If it's a simple matter of getting the missing files from another user, I can attempt that. Otherwise, no published solutions have resolved this issue for me.

-Thank you

I would also be interested in hearing the status of this.

-Chet
